sentence.Network_en: It condemned in extremely strong language what it called Britain's iniquitous campaign.
sentence.Network_cn: 它言辞激烈地谴责了这场它所谓的英国极不公正的竞选活动。

sentence.Network_en: Many historians, of course, regard this as iniquitous.
sentence.Network_cn: 当然，许多历史学家认为这是极不公正的。

sentence.Network_en: Men of feeling may at any moment be killed outright by the iniquitous and the callous.
sentence.Network_cn: 多愁善感的人会立即被罪恶的人和无情的人彻底消灭.

list.abs: an iniquitous system , regime , etc., 罪恶的制度 , 政权等.
" It certainly is a most iniquitous affair , " said Mr. Bennet , " and nothing can clear Mr. Collins from the guilt of inheriting Longbourn .“这的确是一最不公道的事，”班纳特先生说，“柯林斯先生要继承浪博恩的产业，他这桩罪过是洗也洗不清的。

entry.def: If you describe something as iniquitous, you mean that it is very unfair or morally bad.

means.word_mean: 1. characterized by iniquity; wicked because it is believed to be a sin;

sentences.sentence: "he said it was sinful to wear lipstick"

auth_sentence.content: I jump at the chance to be involved in anything that will raise the profile of the issues surrounding our iniquitous system.
auth_sentence.res_content: I jump at the chance to be involved in anything that will raise the profile of the issues surrounding our iniquitous system.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: I jump at the chance to be involved in anything that will raise the profile of the issues surrounding our iniquitous system.

auth_sentence.content: Old social codes, some worthy and some iniquitous, give way because money makes them matter less.
auth_sentence.res_content: Old social codes, some worthy and some iniquitous, give way because money makes them matter less.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Old social codes, some worthy and some iniquitous, give way because money makes them matter less.
